column4: data on  FAT is format from UBUNTu, how can i recover these data
you made a backup of your linux files onto a fat partition?
then I do not understand your question. please rephrase
you probably can not. maybe there is a disk recovery tool out there somewhere but there is no obvious way.
there is a way to undelete data from an ext2 partition called "recover". but i have no idea if there exist a similar tool for FAT partitions
maybe "mondo" can help but I haven't tested it
I just read a bit about mondo and it seems it supports vfat (which is fat32). maybe you should try it "sudo apt-get install mondo"
you don't need a link. simply type "sudo apt-get install mondo" in a terminal and it will be downloaded and installed automatically
ah. I will see what I can find
this is probably what you want http://fr.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/m/mondo/mondo_2.20-1.1_i386.deb

you will need to download these to get it fully installed (find them from the same place as I gave you before, do some digging): afio buffer gawk libfuse2 libntfs8 lzop mindi mindi-busybox mondo ms-sys ntfsprogs syslinux
i don't really know. maybe i gave you the link to the wrong version...
I have 6.06 as well and when I apt-get it that version is what is installed
these are the versions that got installed for me http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/815/
do some digging for the correct files at http://archive.ubuntu.com
http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/ . gawk, libntfs8 libfuse2 ntfsprogs and syslinux are in "main", the others in "universe"
